result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 04-21-16. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal drugs.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction concurrent to 15CM305.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 4-21-2016.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 46  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be starting an in-patient treatment program.  Defense requests a plea sentencing date in mid to late May to allow her to complete this program.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle Anne Sweeney
Current: 12115 West Belmar Drive, Franklin, WI 53132   (Effective: 03-06-2015)
Prior: 12115 West Belmar Drive, Franklin, WI 53132
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.C.Penney at 5300 S. 76th Street

Defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Adjourned initial appearance on March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle Anne Sweeney not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Her social worker called and also faxed in a letter that Ms. Sweeny is a patient at Rogers Memorial Hospital. I rescheduled her court appearance on both of her cases until 3-6-2015, at 1:30 pm. I sent out the letters to her social worker.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/3/15 @ 1 PM
